page.title: 07MEAT PROCESSING ,HARTFORD
page.content:
{Heyeswood farm meat processing plant }
The plant is 9 years old and it used to be a family dairy farm. The meat that is going to be processed is bought in from neighbouring farms. Veal, beef, pork and lamb are the only meats used there. Some meats are processed into sausages, beef burgers and pates. At the plant 12 to 300 pound carcasses are dealt with. When the meat comes into the plant it is left at 0 degrees celsius for 10 days in order to mature. If they did not do this the meat would be too tough and hard to eat. The meat has different grades. The letters E, U, R, O and P show the different amounts of fat on the meat and the numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 show the toughness of the meat.
